    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/reporter-grills-colorado-senate-hopeful-ballot-signatures"/>
    <title>Reporter Corners GOP Candidate For Awkward Grilling On Forged Signatures (VIDEO)</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Despite the tangible awkwardness of the on-camera conversation, a reporter doggedly grilled a U.S. Senate candidate on Thursday about the allegedly forged signatures that got him on the Republican primary ballot in Colorado.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/reporter-grills-colorado-senate-hopeful-ballot-signatures" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Sara Jerde</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463090295" updated="1463090295" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/reporter-grills-colorado-senate-hopeful-ballot-signatures" image="http://a2.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/mmemaozc5j2egvwi4xvq.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249633</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T17:07:13-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T17:07:13-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/world-news/russia-system-evade-olymping-doping-tests"/>
    <title>Russia Used Elaborate System To Evade Olympic Doping Tests</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Russian officials took clean urine from athletes months before the Sochi Olympics, and used soda containers and baby bottles passed through a hole in the wall of a testing lab to evade doping tests, the former head of Russian's anti-doping laboratory told The New York Times.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/world-news/russia-system-evade-olymping-doping-tests" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>JAMES ELLINGWORTH</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463087233" updated="1463087233" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/world-news/russia-system-evade-olymping-doping-tests" image="http://a4.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/wtjsdsq6ruzexwbmuuk9.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249631</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T16:43:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T16:45:55-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/what-about-the-mass-expulsion"/>
    <title>What About the Mass Expulsion?</title>
    <content type="html"><p>I've been wondering about this for a few days. As Donald Trump and the GOP establishment go through this delicate dance toward a marriage of convenience, there are two or three big policy initiatives that are usually referenced as the ones that are just unacceptable to mainstream Republicans, too crazy to be considered, unconstitutional or just too politically damaging. The most frequently mentioned are Trump's proposed ban on Muslims entering the country and the Trump TajMaWall he says Mexico will agree to pay for.</p>

<p>This strikes me as odd because despite how odious these ideas are, there's very little mention of what is undoubtedly the craziest, most dangerous, most expensive and brutal of his policies: his plan to deport roughly 3% of the current US population in 18 months.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/what-about-the-mass-expulsion" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Josh Marshall</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463085780" updated="1463085955" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/what-about-the-mass-expulsion" image="http://a4.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/bzktolu2d9dz2zawjhfg.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249630</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T16:41:14-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T16:41:14-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/facebook-explains-trending-news-curation-amid-backlash"/>
    <title>Facebook Explains Its Trending News Curation Amid Leaks, Allegations Of Bias</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Facebook <a href="https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2016/05/information-about-trending-topics/">clarified its policies</a> for choosing trending news topics on Thursday, following a rough week for the company that began with backlash to a <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/gizmodo-reports-facebook-suppresses-conservative-news">report </a>alleging the social network's "news curators" suppressed conservative news.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/facebook-explains-trending-news-curation-amid-backlash" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Kristin Salaky</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463085674" updated="1463085674" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/facebook-explains-trending-news-curation-amid-backlash" image="http://a1.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/uzfnyhvufqrlhhgddede.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249632</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T16:24:58-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T16:24:58-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/feds-wont-withhold-funding-north-carolina-hb2"/>
    <title>Obama Admin Won’t Withhold Funds From North Carolina Over Anti-LGBT Law</title>
    <content type="html"><p>The White House said Thursday that it doesn't plan to withhold federal funding from North Carolina while the state and the Justice Department fight a legal battle over an anti-LGBT law.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/feds-wont-withhold-funding-north-carolina-hb2" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Allegra Kirkland</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463084698" updated="1463084698" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/feds-wont-withhold-funding-north-carolina-hb2" image="http://a1.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/dagvhh7do6wfamjaijka.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249626</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T15:50:32-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T15:50:32-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/donald-trump-gop-senators-meeting"/>
    <title>GOP Senators Swoon Over Donald Trump After Hill Meeting</title>
    <content type="html"><p>After Donald Trump's much-ballyhooed trip Thursday to Capitol Hill, some Republican senators present in his meeting with GOP Senate leadership praised him for his willingness to "listen" behind closed doors.</p>

<p>"He was like I've always known: very straightforward ... very open about what he believes, very cordial," Sen. Orrin Hatch (R-UT) -- the most-senior Republican senator and one of those present at the meeting -- told reporters in the Capitol Thursday afternoon.</p>

<p>"I've always been impressed, but I was really impressed today," Hatch said.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/donald-trump-gop-senators-meeting" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Tierney Sneed</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463082632" updated="1463082632" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/donald-trump-gop-senators-meeting" image="http://a5.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/kfk9jgdr19tukygzyysy.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249629</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T15:46:07-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T15:46:07-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/no-charges-fatal-police-shooting-jeremy-mcdole"/>
    <title>No Charges For 4 Officers In Fatal Shooting Of Man In Wheelchair</title>
    <content type="html"><p>DOVER, Del. (AP) — Criminal charges cannot be brought against four Wilmington police officers involved in the fatal shooting of a man in a wheelchair, although one officer exhibited "extraordinarily poor" police work and should not be allowed to carry a gun in public, the Delaware attorney general's office concluded in a report released Thursday.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/no-charges-fatal-police-shooting-jeremy-mcdole" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>RANDALL CHASE</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463082367" updated="1463082367" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/no-charges-fatal-police-shooting-jeremy-mcdole" image="http://a5.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/nbwnkjdn1o6yu4lzefla.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249627</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T15:42:57-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T15:42:57-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/rubio-knows-exactly-when-the-filding-deadline-is-to-run-for-florida-senate"/>
    <title>Rubio Knows Exactly When The Florida Filing Deadline Is For His Senate Seat</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Since dropping out of the presidential race, Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) has said he isn't reconsidering his decision not to seek another term in the U.S. Senate, but he knows exactly when the deadline is to change his mind and run again. </p>

<p>In a brief hallway interview Thursday on Capitol Hill, Rubio obfuscated when asked if he was at all tempted to run again for his Senate seat. </p>

<p>"I'm not focused on that. I've already said what my intentions are and at this point you know [we] have people out there running already," Rubio said. </p>

<p>Reminded that he had until the end of June, the interview concluded. Rubio walked away, turned, smiled and said, "June 24."</p>

<p>His office said Rubio's plans for 2017 are still unchanged and that he was making the comment in jest. </p>

<p>"It was a joke. He’s going to serve out the rest of his Senate term and become a private citizen in January 2017," a spokesman from his office said.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/rubio-knows-exactly-when-the-filding-deadline-is-to-run-for-florida-senate" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Lauren Fox</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463082177" updated="1463082177" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/rubio-knows-exactly-when-the-filding-deadline-is-to-run-for-florida-senate" image="http://a3.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/dhz8h24daskckvhhexvl.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249625</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T15:35:06-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T15:35:06-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/obama-2016-election-republican-course-correction"/>
    <title>Obama Predicts 2016 Election Will Course-Correct An 'Extreme' GOP</title>
    <content type="html"><p>President Barack Obama thinks that the 2016 presidential election could trigger the “corrective” he thinks the Republican Party needs in order to not fall prey to its most “extreme” elements.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/obama-2016-election-republican-course-correction" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Allegra Kirkland</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463081706" updated="1463081706" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/obama-2016-election-republican-course-correction" image="http://a5.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/r3lrsaoizvgvkei4xdnt.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249628</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T15:34:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T15:38:01-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/trump-gets-kochy"/>
    <title>Trump Gets Kochy</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Start taking the establishment money and you'll start taking the establishment policy positions soon enough. </p>

<p>It's a little hard to get a sense of just what to make or just how seriously to take the policy initiatives Trump is getting behind as he moves from the emotive issues that are really driving his campaign to positions on the countless nuts and bolts issues the federal government must confront. At the center of the story is a guy named Sam Clovis, a Tea Party activist from Iowa who has been a campaign co-chair for some time and now is labeled his "chief policy advisor."</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/trump-gets-kochy" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Josh Marshall</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463081640" updated="1463081881" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/trump-gets-kochy" image="http://a4.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/yuo8zejlvt43aerqzq7m.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249624</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T14:48:34-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T14:48:34-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/greg-abbott-hb2-fight-back"/>
    <title>Texas Guv Ready To 'Fight Back' For North Carolina Anti-LGBT Bill</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Texas Gov. Greg Abbott (R) on Thursday said that he will support North Carolina in its legal battle with the federal government over the controversial new anti-LGBT law.</p>

<p>"I am working with the governor of North Carolina, and we are going to fight back," <a href="http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/politics/Gov-Greg-Abbott-Lt-Gov-Dan-Patrick-to-Speak-at-GOP-Convention-in-Dallas-379193041.html">Abbott said</a> during his speech at the Texas Republican Convention.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/greg-abbott-hb2-fight-back" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Caitlin MacNeal</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463078914" updated="1463078914" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/greg-abbott-hb2-fight-back" image="http://a5.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/d4078lx5re0f9fmjumh4.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249623</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T14:30:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T18:08:51-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/trump-butler-post-obama-shot"/>
    <title>Trump's Butler Writes That Obama Should've Been Shot In His First Term</title>
    <content type="html"><p>U.S. Secret Service was investigating presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's longtime butler, after <a href="http://www.motherjones.com/politics/2016/05/trump-butler-anthony-senecal-facebook-kill-obama#testb">Mother Jones reported</a> he wrote on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/anthonypetersenecal">Facebook</a> that he thought President Obama should've been killed in his first term.</p>

<p>The campaign went on to say it disavowed the statements the butler made as he continued to critique Obama on Thursday, telling media outlets that he would like to see the president hung from "the portico of the White House," <a href="http://www.cnn.com/2016/05/12/politics/donald-trump-butler-barack-obama/">CNN reported</a>.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/trump-butler-post-obama-shot" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Sara Jerde</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463077800" updated="1463090931" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/trump-butler-post-obama-shot" image="http://a4.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/ydjkuln156ebjlvkzagq.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249618</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T14:15:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T14:22:44-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/paul-ryan-s-impossible-choice-on-donald-trump"/>
    <title>The Most Donald Trump Will Get From Paul Ryan Is A Marriage Of Convenience</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Paul Ryan barely knows Donald Trump, and yet he's on the verge of gambling his and his party's political future on him.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/paul-ryan-s-impossible-choice-on-donald-trump" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Lauren Fox</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463076900" updated="1463077364" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/dc/paul-ryan-s-impossible-choice-on-donald-trump" image="http://a3.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/fmlunqwy4xjhgmndoczy.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249622</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T14:00:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T14:02:58-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/watch-the-senators"/>
    <title>Watch the Senators</title>
    <content type="html"><p>All signs point to the House GOP falling quickly into line with Donald Trump. Indeed, it's not clear to me that #NeverTrump even really exists anymore outside of a thin membrane of conservative writers and intellectuals who may be acting admirably but have little real electoral pull. But remember, the House is heavily gerrymandered. It may be plausible that a total blowout at the top of the ticket could lose Republicans the House. But it's not likely. For a number of reasons, House Republicans have a lot of ways to bundle up to withstand a Trump electoral storm, if indeed it turns out to be a storm.</p>

<p>The Senate is an altogether different matter.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/watch-the-senators" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Josh Marshall</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463076000" updated="1463076178" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/watch-the-senators"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249621</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T13:17:30-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T13:17:30-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/lancet-study-global-abortion-rates"/>
    <title>Study: Abortion Rates Same In Countries Where Procedure Legal Vs. Restricted</title>
    <content type="html"><p>LONDON (AP) — The rate of abortions in the developed world has dropped to an all-time low while remaining steady in poorer regions, where nearly 90 percent of the abortions worldwide occur, researchers say in a new study published Wednesday in the journal Lancet.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/lancet-study-global-abortion-rates" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>MARIA CHENG</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463073450" updated="1463073450" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/lancet-study-global-abortion-rates" image="http://a3.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/sg4wgiylxvfwukbdwwhr.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249620</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T13:09:00-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T13:18:45-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/house-gop-wins-obamacare-lawsuit"/>
    <title>Federal Judge Sides With House GOP On Obamacare Funding</title>
    <content type="html"><p>WASHINGTON (AP) -€” A federal judge has ruled that the Obama administration is unconstitutionally spending federal money to fund the president's health care law.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/house-gop-wins-obamacare-lawsuit" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>SAM HANANEL</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463072940" updated="1463073525" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/house-gop-wins-obamacare-lawsuit" image="http://a1.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/fbt1hv9vhsvygemvwn1a.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249619</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T13:02:15-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T13:02:15-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/boehner-house-freedom-caucus-knuckleheads"/>
    <title>House Freedom Caucus Hits Back After Boehner Calls Them 'Knuckleheads'</title>
    <content type="html"><p>Former House Speaker John Boehner (R-OH) is unplugged and unleashed and apparently reveling in his new-found freedom. </p>

<p>Not so much the so-called House Freedom Caucus.</p>

<p>During a conference in Las Vegas on Thursday, Boehner laid into the House Freedom Caucus, eliciting a response from the caucus' members.</p>

<p><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-lang="en"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">.<a href="https://twitter.com/SteveRattner">@SteveRattner</a> asks <a href="https://twitter.com/johnboehner">@johnboehner</a> about the Freedom Caucus. <br>
Boehner: "Knuckleheads. We call them knuckleheads."</p>

<p>— Phil Mattingly (@Phil_Mattingly) <a href="https://twitter.com/Phil_Mattingly/status/730780560696737792">May 12, 2016</a></p>

<p></blockquote></p>

<p><script async src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script></p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/boehner-house-freedom-caucus-knuckleheads" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>Caitlin MacNeal</name>
    </author>
    <meta published="1463072535" updated="1463072535" permalink="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/boehner-house-freedom-caucus-knuckleheads" image="http://a2.img.talkingpointsmemo.com/image/upload/c_fill,fl_keep_iptc,g_faces,h_365,w_652/xpesqc7ydbxdxqfhhmu0.jpg"/>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <id>249617</id>
    <published>2016-05-12T12:51:34-04:00</published>
    <updated>2016-05-12T12:51:34-04:00</updated>
    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/dennis-hastert-no-appeal-conviction-sentence"/>
    <title>Ex-Speaker Hastert Won't Appeal Conviction, Sentence In Hush Money Case</title>
    <content type="html"><p>CHICAGO (AP) — Dennis Hastert's lead attorney says the former U.S. House speaker won't appeal his conviction or 15-month prison term in a hush-money case centered on his sexual abuse of students when he was a high school wrestling coach in Illinois decades ago.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/dennis-hastert-no-appeal-conviction-sentence" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>MICHAEL TARM</name>
    </author>

    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/tamron-hall-marsha-blackburn-tense-interview-trump"/>
    <title>MSNBC Host Grills GOPer On Trump: Little Late To Be Getting To Know Him! (VIDEO)</title>
    <content type="html"><p>MSNBC host Tamron Hall pushed Rep. Marsha Blackburn (R-TN) in a Thursday interview to give a straight answer on how the GOP could embrace Donald Trump as its presumptive presidential nominee, arguing it was "a little late" for the party to become “curious” about his unorthodox policy proposals.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/livewire/tamron-hall-marsha-blackburn-tense-interview-trump" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>

    <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/dean-skelos-former-new-york-senate-leader-five-years-prison-corruption--2"/>
    <title>Ex-NY Senate Leader Dean Skelos Gets 5 Years In Prison For Corruption</title>
    <content type="html"><p>NEW YORK (AP) — A once-powerful New York politician convicted of using his position as Senate majority leader to pressure companies to provide hundreds of thousands of dollars for his son was sentenced Thursday to five years in prison, the latest in a spate of corruption cases that have roiled Albany.</p> <a href="http://talkingpointsmemo.com/news/dean-skelos-former-new-york-senate-leader-five-years-prison-corruption--2" class="read-more">Read More&nbsp;&rarr;</a></content>
    <author>
      <name>TOM HAYS and LARRY NEUMEISTER</name>
    </author>
